p: Ginger otherwise known as the root of Zingiber officinale Roscoe is commonly used as spice and discovered to have diverse pharmacological activities such as anti-inflammation, antitumor, and antioxidant properties [ 7â€“ 9]. According to Oboh et al. [ 10], extract of ginger rhizomes inhibits acetylcholinesterase activity (key regulatory enzyme involved in neurodegeneration) in vitro. Furthermore, volatile oil of ginger has been reported to influence both cell-mediated immune response and nonspecific proliferation of T lymphocyte [ 11].
